message_1: A message "HELLO WORLD" is encrypted using a transposition cipher with the key "3142" which means the first letter of the message is placed in the 3rd position, the second letter in the 1st position, the third letter in the 4th position, and so on. What is the encrypted message?
message_2:
To encrypt the message "HELLO WORLD" using the transposition cipher with the key "3142", we need to rearrange the letters according to the key. We can do this by breaking the message into groups of 4 characters and applying the key to each group.

1. Break the message into groups of 4 characters:
   HELLO WORLD -> (HELL) (O WO) (RLD)

2. Apply the key to each group:
   (HELL) -> (EHL L)
   (O WO) -> (OOW )
   (RLD) -> (LDR)

3. Combine the encrypted groups:
   EHL LOOW LDR

So, the encrypted message is "EHL LOOW LDR".
